data.Name: Deconvolution
data.Description: A process designed to restore a waveshape to the form it had before it underwent a linear filtering action (convolution)
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Demultiple
data.Description: Corrections applied to seismic data to compensate for the effects of multiple reflections
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Demultiplex
data.Description:
Corrections applied to seismic data to compensate for the effects of
variations in elevation, near-surface low-velocity-layer (weathering)
thickness, weathering velocity, and/or reference to a datumTo separate the individual component channels that have been multiplexed.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Field
data.Description: Processing performed at the time of data acquisition site.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Inversion
data.Description: Deriving from field data a model to describe the subsurface that is consistent with the data; determining the cause from observation of effects.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Migration
data.Description: An inversion operation involving rearrangement of seismic information elements so that reflections and diffractions are plotted at their true locations.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Phase rotation
data.Description: Phase distortion imposed on the received seismic signal by the data-acquisition system must be accounted for and corrected.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Stack
data.Description: A composite record made by combining traces from different records.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Statics
data.Description: Often called statics, a bulk shift of a seismic trace in time during seismic processing. A common static correction is the weathering correction, which compensates for a layer of low seismic velocity material near the surface of the Earth.
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Modeling result
data.Description: Indicates that the Seismic processing is at the Modeling Result stage
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).

data.Name: Synthetic model
data.Description: Indicates that the Seismic processing is at the Synthetic modeling stage
data.Source: Workbook curated by PPDM; commit SHA - No SHA (Workbook not committed).
